entity.name: <​select>
entity.description: Pain points related to the `<select>` element.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the <select> element.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the <select> element.

entity.name: Date Picker
entity.description: Pain points related to `<input type="date">` and its associated picker UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to <input type="date"> and its associated picker UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to <input type="date"> and its associated picker UI.

entity.name: <​dialog> Element
entity.description: Pain points related to the native HTML `<dialog>` element.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the native HTML <dialog> element.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the native HTML <dialog> element.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: <​datalist>
entity.description: Pain points related to the `<datalist>` element, including styling and inconsistent UI.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the <datalist> element, including styling and inconsistent UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the <datalist> element, including styling and inconsistent UI.

example.codeHighlighted: <input name="country" list="countries"> <datalist id="countries"> <option>Afghanistan</option> ... </datalist>

webFeature.description_html: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
webFeature.name: <datalist>

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionHtml: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

webFeature.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
webFeature.name: <details>

entity.name: Popover API
entity.description: Pain points specific to Popover API.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points specific to Popover API.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points specific to Popover API.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.name: Web Components
entity.description: Pain points related to authoring and using Web Components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, etc.).
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to authoring and using Web Components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to authoring and using Web Components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, etc.).

entity.description: Pain points related to the `<button>` element, including its default behaviors within a form.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the <button> element, including its default behaviors within a form.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the <button> element, including its default behaviors within a form.

entity.name: CSS Anchor Positioning
entity.description: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to the CSS Anchor Positioning API, often in conjunction with the Popover API. Includes issues with browser support and the perceived necessity of this API for positioning popovers and tooltips effectively.

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

entity.name: Form validation
entity.description: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (`<input pattern>`, `<input required>`, `input. setCustomValidity(msg)` etc)
entity.descriptionHtml: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)
entity.descriptionClean: Set of HTML attributes and JS APIs to facilitate client-side form validation (<input pattern>, <input required>, input. setCustomValidity(msg) etc)

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="zip" pattern="[0-9]{5}" title="5 digits" required />

entity.name: Customizable select
entity.description: A <select> element that is stylable and has more UI flexibility
entity.descriptionHtml: A  element that is stylable and has more UI flexibility
entity.descriptionClean: A  element that is stylable and has more UI flexibility

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API — Smashing Magazine

webFeature.description_html: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
webFeature.name: Customizable <select>

entity.descriptionHtml: Issues with the user experience and appearance of <select multiple>.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues with the user experience and appearance of <select multiple>.

entity.name: Searchable select

entity.descriptionClean: The lack of a built-in ability to search or filter the options within a <select> element.

entity.name: Web Components
entity.description: Pain points related to authoring and using Web Components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, etc.).
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to authoring and using Web Components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, etc.).
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to authoring and using Web Components (Custom Elements, Shadow DOM, etc.).

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Shadow trees, encapsulation boundaries, slotting, parts, cross-root ARIA and integration with events, other APIs and page elements. Combine with `styling` for shadow DOM styling issues.
entity.descriptionHtml: Shadow trees, encapsulation boundaries, slotting, parts, cross-root ARIA and integration with events, other APIs and page elements. Combine with styling for shadow DOM styling issues.
entity.descriptionClean: Shadow trees, encapsulation boundaries, slotting, parts, cross-root ARIA and integration with events, other APIs and page elements. Combine with styling for shadow DOM styling issues.

example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM
